doyoumind.mq package¶

Submodules¶

doyoumind.mq.constants module¶

doyoumind.mq.consumer_parser module¶

class doyoumind.mq.consumer_parser.ConsumerParser(url, callback)¶

Bases: object

doyoumind.mq.consumer_parser.rabbitmq_consumer(f, callback)¶

Given a driver url for the server’s rabbitmq message queue, and a callback function of the form parser –> (body –> result), create a consumer function that connects indefinitely to the mq, applying the given callback on every consumed message.

Parameters

  • f (furl.furl) – the driver’s url

  • callback (function (str-->str)-->(str-->?)) – a function that takes a parser as input, and returns a callback function.

Returns

the consume function

Return type

function none–>none

doyoumind.mq.consumer_parser_atomic module¶

class doyoumind.mq.consumer_parser_atomic.ConsumerParserAtomic(url, topic, callback)¶

Bases: object

doyoumind.mq.consumer_parser_atomic.rabbitmq_consumer(f, topic, callback)¶

Given a driver url for the server’s rabbitmq message queue, and a callback function of the form parser –> (body –> result), create a consumer function that connects indefinitely to the mq, applying the given callback on every consumed message.

Parameters

  • f (furl.furl) – the driver’s url

  • topic (str) – name of a topic to be parsed

  • callback (function str-->none) – a function that takes a parser as input, and returns a callback function.

Returns

the consume function

Return type

function none–>none

doyoumind.mq.consumer_saver module¶

class doyoumind.mq.consumer_saver.ConsumerSaver(url, callback)¶

Bases: object

doyoumind.mq.consumer_saver.rabbitmq_consumer(f, callback)¶

Given a driver url for the saver’s rabbitmq message queue, and a callback function of the form topic –> (body –> result), create a consumer function that connects indefinitely to the mq, applying the given callback on every consumed message.

Parameters

  • f (furl.furl) – the driver’s url

  • callback (function str-->(str-->?)) – a function that takes a topic as input, and returns a callback function.

Returns

the consume function

Return type

function none–>none

doyoumind.mq.publisher_parser module¶

class doyoumind.mq.publisher_parser.PublisherParser(url)¶

Bases: object

A publisher that gets snapshot data from the server, and publishes it to all queues on the server’s exchange so it’ll get parsed. :param url: the mq driver’s url (currently only supports the format ‘rabbitmq://id:port/’) :type url: str :param publish: the publish function :type publish: function str–>?

doyoumind.mq.publisher_parser.rabbitmq_publisher(f)¶

Given a driver url for the server’s rabbitmq message queue, Bind the server exchange to multiple queues, each one representing a different parser. Return a function that given a message, publishes it to the exchange using fanout. :param f: the driver’s url :type f: furl.furl :returns: the publish function :rtype: function str–>?

doyoumind.mq.publisher_saver module¶

class doyoumind.mq.publisher_saver.PublisherSaver(url)¶

Bases: object

A publisher that, given parse results, that gets snapshot results from the server, and publishes it to all queues on the server’s exchange so it’ll get parsed. :param url: the mq driver’s url (currently only supports the format ‘rabbitmq://id:port/’) :type url: str :param publish: the publish function :type publish: function str–>?

doyoumind.mq.publisher_saver.rabbitmq_publisher(f)¶

Creates a new exchange with the given name, and binds it to multiple queues, each one representing a different parser. Returns a function that given a message, publishes it to the exchange using fanout. for the publisher–>consumer interaction: SERVER_EXCHANGE. for the consumer–>saver: SAVER_EXCHANGE.

doyoumind.mq.publisher_saver_atomic module¶

class doyoumind.mq.publisher_saver_atomic.PublisherSaverAtomic(url, topic)¶

Bases: object

doyoumind.mq.publisher_saver_atomic.rabbitmq_publisher(f, topic)¶

publishes the consumed parser result to the saver’s queue.

doyoumind.mq.publisher_saver_atomic.run_parser(parser_type, data)¶

Runs the parser with the given topic on the given data. Returns a string, to be later saved in the saver as the value of the topic.
